subject: Re: Private method throws an exception
msgSnippet: ... Most often when I see this symptom -- a private method or something deep in the hierarchy failing, and preventing testing -- it s because the code I m
messageBody:
>> --- mitchellch60 wrote:
>>> My method under test calls a private method in the same
>>> class. The private method throws an exception preventing
>>> me for completing my unit test.

--- "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@r...> wrote:
> I understand you don't believe in polluting the public API,
> but saying that that suggestion won't solve the problem is
> ridiculous.
> [...]

Most often when I see this symptom -- a private method or something
deep in the hierarchy failing, and preventing testing -- it's because
the code I'm testing is using some external resource, such as a
database, that really needs a Mock Object implementation for testing.

I don't have enough information to be sure that this is the proper
advice, but in my experience, it's been a good guess. (...until more
detailed information becomes available.)
